greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered ways to write n as 4^k*(1+x^2+y^2)+5*z^2, where k,x,y,z are nonnegative integers with x <= y.
comment: This is stronger than the known fact that any natural number can be written as w^2 + x^2 + y^2 + 5*z^2 with w,x,y,z integers.
See also A275656, A275676 and A275678 for similar conjectures.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Refining Lagrange's four-square theorem, arXiv:1604.06723 [math.GM], 2016.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Aug 04 2016
